response_parsed.title: Securing Event-Driven Systems Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides a comprehensive guide on how to build and secure an event-driven system using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI's built-in features for security like OAuth2, JWT, and OpenAPI security extensions
Implementing HTTPS for secure communication between client and server
Using FastAPI middleware for custom authentication
Handling CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) for securing access to your API

code_examples.code:

# Define OAuth2 password bearer scheme

# Secure an endpoint

import os
from fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException
app = FastAPI()

# Set up HTTPS (requires an SSL certificate)
scheme = 'https' if 'HTTPS_ENABLED' in os.environ else 'http'
nif os.getenv('FASTAPI_SSL_KEY') and os.getenv('FASTAPI_SSL_CERT'):
    app.server = SSLServer(app, keyfile=os.getenv('FASTAPI_SSL_KEY'), certfile=os.getenv('FASTAPI_SSL_CERT'))

# Ensure HTTPS is used by default
app.routes = [Route(path=path, methods=[method], scheme=scheme) for path, method in app.routes]
